properties.name: Duo Secret Key
properties.description: The secret key key for your Duo Admin API integration. This can be found in the integration's information inyour Duo admin panel

properties.name: ServiceNow Instance URL
properties.description: The URL of your ServiceNow instance. For example: mycompany.service-now.com

properties.name: Webex Access Token
properties.description: The access token to use to authenticate to the Webex API. Information about using a bot, which is what we recommend, can be found here: https://developer.webex.com/docs/bots

properties.name: Secure Endpoint Environment URL
properties.description: Placeholder for the URL of the Secure Endpoint environment being used. You don't need to provide this, it will be fetched automatically

properties.name: Webex Room Name
properties.description: The name of the Webex room to post messages to. If using a bot, make sure to invite your bot to the room before attempting to send messages. If you don't want to use Webex, leave this blank

properties.name: SecureX Environment URL
properties.description: Placeholder for the URL of the SecureX environment being used. You don't need to provide this, it will be fetched automatically

properties.name: Duo Username Suffix
properties.description: Usernames are fetched using Orbital and often come back as something like "bobjones." If your Duo usernames are email addresses, you may want to add a suffix of "@mycompany.com" using this variable. This is optional

properties.name: User List
properties.description: Placeholder for a list of users to be added to the Duo DENY group

properties.name: ServiceNow Text
properties.description: Placeholder used to assemble text for a ServiceNow ticket

properties.name: Duo Hostname
properties.description: The hostname for your Duo Admin API integration. This can be found in the integration's information inyour Duo admin panel

properties.name: Webex Remediation Step Text
properties.description: Placeholder used to assemble text for Webex messages

properties.name: Webex Text
properties.description: Placholder used to assemble text for Webex

properties.name: Duo Integration Key
properties.description: The integration key for your Duo Admin API integration. This can be found in the integration's information inyour Duo admin panel

properties.name: Email Findings
properties.description: Placeholder used to to store information about SMA module results

properties.name: Approval Task Text
properties.description: Placeholder used to assemble text for the approval task

properties.name: Duo Deny User Group
properties.description: The ID of the user group you want to add Duo users to when they're considered compromised by this workflow. You can get this ID from the URL of the group's page in the Duo admin panel. For example: DGWP6584D8PORPPC9H01

properties.name: Malicious IP
properties.description: Placeholder used to store malicious IP addresses in

This workflow checks Cisco Threat Response for incidents generated by Cisco Secure Firewall Impact Red events every 10 minutes. If matching incidents are found, an investigation is performed to identify related observables including endpoints, domains, file hashes, and users. After investigation is complete, approval will be requested to perform automated remediation. If approved, the observables discovered will be remediated (remediation actions vary by observable type).

Note: This workflow has been updated to support SecureX Token account keys. See the workflow documentation for more information.

Documentation: https://ciscosecurity.github.io/sxo-05-security-workflows/workflows/0013

Target Group: Default TargetGroup

Targets: CTR_API, Duo Security, Orbital_For_Access_Token, Orbital_Target, Private_CTIA_Target, ServiceNow, Webex Teams

import sys, re

link = sys.argv[1]

incident = re.findall(r"(incident-[a-zA-Z0-9\-]+)$", link)
incident = incident[0]

**APPROVAL REQUESTED FOR AUTOMATED RECOMMENDED ACTIONS**
Approval is required for automated remediation in response to a HIGH severity security event.

**Automated Investigation Results**
- [Investigate in SecureX Threat Response](https://visibility.$workflow.definition_workflow_01M8YO6NV4TVT6c3JgFxA4BI7ZVhP3LToQK.local.variable_workflow_01M93K26MNY2G7I8eP6RBUygQC6PdWZWXeX$/investigate?id=$activity.definition_activity_01M8YP1HK5H8474zYpk5qrAN6d3Cl8KFrHR.output.script_queries.incidentId$)
